intro: Setaria sulcata subsp. parvifolia, commonly known as parvifolia foxtail, is a grass species native to Africa. It is characterized by its slender, hairy leaves and narrow, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its seeds are small and wind-dispersed, contributing to its adaptability. It is often used as a forage crop due to its hardiness and nutritional value.
